text: Psalm 35
A Prayer for Rescue from Enemies
Of David.\f + \fr Ps 35 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
Contend, O Yahweh, with my contenders;
fight \add those who\add* fight me.
Grasp buckler and shield
and rise to my aid.
And draw \add the\add* spear and javelin to meet \add those who\add* pursue me.
Say to my soul, “I \add am\add* your salvation.”
Let those who seek my life be shamed and humiliated.
Let those who plot calamity against me be repulsed and ashamed.
Let them be like chaff before \add the\add* wind,
with the angel of Yahweh ⸤driving them⸥.\f + \fr 35:5 \ft Literally “pushing” \f*
Let their way be dark and slippery,
with the angel of Yahweh pursuing them.
For without cause they secretly hide the pit with their net for me;
without cause they dug \add it\add* for my life.
Let ⸤unforeseen ruin⸥\f + \fr 35:8 \ft Literally “ruin he does not know” \f* come on him,
and his net that he hid, let it catch him.
Let him fall into it in ruin.
Then my soul will rejoice in Yahweh;
it will rejoice in his salvation.
All of my bones shall say, “O Yahweh, who \add is\add* like you,
who delivers \add the\add* poor from \add one\add* stronger than he
and \add the\add* poor and needy from \add the one who\add* robs him?”
Violent witnesses rise up;
they ask me \add concerning\add* what I do not know.
They repay me evil in place of good.
\add It is\add* bereavement to my soul.
But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing \add was\add* sackcloth.
I weakened my soul with fasting,
and my prayer ⸤returned to me unanswered⸥.\f + \fr 35:13 \ft Literally “upon my lap it will return” \f*
I ⸤behaved⸥\f + \fr 35:14 \ft Literally “walked about” \f* as \add though he were\add* a friend \add or\add* as a brother to me.
As one lamenting a mother, I was bowed down \add in\add* mourning.
But at my stumbling they rejoiced and gathered together;
smiters whom I did not know gathered against me.
They tore and did not cease.
Among \add the\add* ungodly of the mockers at feasts,\f + \fr 35:16 \ft With a slight change the Hebrew might read, “The ungodly boldly mocked” \f*
\add they\add* gnashed at me with their teeth.
My Lord, how long will you watch?
Restore my life from their ravages,\f + \fr 35:17 \ft Or “roaring” \f*
my only \add life\add* from \add the\add* young lions.
I will give thanks \add to\add* you in \add the\add* great assembly;
among \add the\add* mighty people I will praise you.
Let not those who \add are\add* wrongfully my enemies\f + \fr 35:19 \ft Or “those who oppose me \fq with \ft falsehood” \f* rejoice over me.
\add Nor let\add* those who hate me without cause wink \add the\add* eye.
For they do not speak peace,
but against \add the\add* quiet \add ones\add* of \add the\add* land
they plan deceitful words.
They also made wide their mouths\f + \fr 35:21 \ft Hebrew “mouth” \f* against me.
They said, “Aha! Aha!
Our eyes have seen \add it\add*.”
You have seen, O Yahweh. Do not be deaf.
O Lord, do not be far from me.
Wake up and rouse yourself for my right,
for my cause, O my God and my Lord.
Vindicate me according to your righteousness,
O Yahweh my God,
and do not let them rejoice over me.
Do not let them say in their hearts,\f + \fr 35:25 \ft Hebrew “heart” \f* “Aha, our desire.”
Let them not say, “We have swallowed him up.”
Let them be shamed and abashed altogether,
who rejoice at my misfortune.
Let them put on shame and insult,
who magnify themselves against me.
Let them shout for joy and be glad,
who delight in my vindication;
and let them say continually, “Yahweh is great,
who delights in the welfare of his servant.”
Then my tongue will proclaim your righteousness,
\add and\add* your praise all day.
